title: Here is my last rant on the scorecard system knowing it won't ever be changed
body:
Ascencion mode, Hecarim, game won 200 - 140.

I got the highest score at 54, but the lowest or second lowest KDA on my team, so I got a B-.

But here is the kicker, the game has no idea how many times I stopped the enemy from capturing points or killing me or my team, due to Hecarim's speed, I was able to easily get across the map and slow the enemy before my team arrived to get the kills, thus limiting their score and enabling us to win easier.

And thanks to 2 of my team mates for getting lots of kills, it worked perfectly, I charge in, disrupt the enemy, run around in circles and let my team get the kills, we won easily. The game however, has NO IDEA I was playing this way, it only recognised my stats. Although you CAN make it recognise damage taken as actually put effort into making it a high scoring stat, I was second most taken and with second assists on my team, 1+1= I done SOMETHING to slow the enemy down.

But no, I get a bad KDA and least damage done total so I get a shot scorecard, not taking anything into account that I got the best score on my team.

You have your priorities wrong Riot, really wrong. You are rewarding single play and helping those who do nothing but get kills get a good score and limiting those who actually know how to win in getting bad scores.

What, did you want me to be selfish, use an assassin and do nothing but get kills? Because that is what your score system is telling me to do.

replies.body: its ascension. literally who cares. mastery shouldn't even be in that gamemode

You can't even get tokens in Ascension. Can you stop complaining about score cards because if you are decicated player you will get your Ss, and even if you solo carry but the system doesn't pick up on it it doesn't matter because it is for mastery of champions, boxes come with that.

why are you ranting in public knowing nothing will be done and you won't feel any better? what do you get out of getting mastery? you got the "best score" on your team. isn't that good enough already? being spiteful won't get you anywhere (not anywhere pleasant at least), life's a lot more unfair than that
